articles.title: Karnataka leads centre in AVGC support, aims to create 50,000 jobs by 2028: IT/BT minister Priyank Kharge
articles.summary: Karnataka IT/BT minister Priyank Kharge said that Karnataka aims to create 50,000 jobs in the Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming, and Comics (AVGC) sector by 2028, claiming it leads the country in supportive policies. The state hosts over 300 studios and set up an AVGC Centre of Excellence with Rs 150 crore funding. It will also host GAFX 2026, a major global AVGC conference.

articles.title: Peloton cuts 11% of jobs, with engineering teams getting hit
articles.summary: Peloton Interactive, the long-struggling fitness technology company, slashed 11% of its workforce in a cost-cutting move. The cutback mostly affects engineers working on technology and efforts for enterprise customers.

articles.title: Amazon layoffs 2026: Company trims 1,400 workforce in Seattle as local tech jobs wither
articles.summary: Amazon layoffs 2026: Amazon's 16,000 job cuts announced this week include about 1,400 in Seattle and approximately 700 in the neighboring suburb of Bellevue, according to documents filed with state and local authorities.

articles.title: Trendforce sees chip prices surging 90-95% in Q1 from previous quarter
articles.summary: Market ​researcher TrendForce said on Monday ⁠that it has raised its chip price ‌forecasts and expects ‌conventional DRAM contract prices ‌to jump by 90% to 95% in the January to March period ​of this ​year, from the final three ‌months ‍of 2025, citing ‍the artificial intelligence boom.

articles.title: Snapchat blocks 415,000 underage accounts in Australia
articles.summary: Snapchat has blocked 415,000 accounts under Australia's social media ban for under-16s, the company said Monday, but warned some youngsters may be bypassing age verification technology. As of the end of January, Snapchat said it had blocked or disabled 415,000 Snapchat accounts in Australia belonging to under-16s.

articles.title: Nvidia boss insists 'huge' investment in OpenAI on track
articles.summary: Nvidia chief executive Jensen Huang has insisted the US tech giant will make a "huge" investment in OpenAI and dismissed as "nonsense" reports that he is unhappy with the generative AI star. We are going to make a huge investment in OpenAI," Huang told journalists, when asked about reports that he was unhappy with OpenAI. Huang insisted that Nvidia was going ahead with its investment in OpenAI, describing it as "one of the most consequential companies of our time".

articles.title: X back up after brief outage hits US users, Downdetector shows
articles.summary: There were ​more than ​19,281 reports of ‌issues ‍with ‍the social media platform formerly ‌known as Twitter, as of 11:19 a.m. ET, according ‍to Downdetector, which tracks ‍outages by ⁠collating ⁠status reports from a number of sources.

articles.title: Content economy gets a push in Budget 2026, industry says creator labs will improve talent supply
articles.summary: Gaming and animation startup founders from the sector — which is also called the `Orange Economy’ — told ET that early exposure at the school and college level could familiarise students with industry tools, workflows, and creative thinking. This in turn will improve their employability and ease hiring pressures as companies scale.

articles.title: India hands Apple a win by letting foreign firms fund equipment without tax risk
articles.summary: Apple has been growing in India in recent years as it diversifies beyond China. Counterpoint Research says iPhone's share of the ‌Indian market has doubled ‌to 8% since 2022. And while China still accounts for 75% of global iPhone shipments, India's share has quadrupled to 25% since 2022.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Gaming industry welcomes proposal for creator labs in schools, colleges
articles.summary: FM Sitharaman proposed government support for the Indian Institute of Creative Technologies (IICT), Mumbai, to set up animation, visual effects, gaming, and comics (AVGC) creator labs in 15,000 secondary schools and 500 colleges across the country.

articles.title: UPI transactions hit record high of Rs 28.33 lakh crore in January
articles.summary: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions hit a new high in January. Value crossed Rs 28.33 lakh crore. Volume reached 21.70 billion transactions. This shows strong growth from the previous month. Daily transactions averaged 700 million. This digital payment system continues its impressive expansion across India.

articles.title: Factory activity firms up in January amid weak outlook
articles.summary: India's manufacturing activity saw a slight rebound in January, driven by increased new orders and output, though business confidence dipped to a three-and-a-half-year low. While consumer goods led the growth, capital goods lagged, and future output expectations weakened despite buoyant domestic demand and moderate international orders.

articles.title: Adding AI to the shopping cart
articles.summary: AI behemoths and startups are betting on shopping as the next frontier of growth. ET shops around the trends and road bumps.

articles.title: Edtech gains as smaller towns turn up big for English lessons
articles.summary: While WestBridge-backed SpeakX and Lightspeed-backed Stimuler are among startups focused on English learning, larger test-preparation platforms such as Adda247 and Physics Wallah have expanded into this space. With generative AI addressing the technology layer, multiple apps are getting launched, industry executives said.

articles.title: 'Moltbook' social media site for AI agents had big security hole, cyber firm Wiz says
articles.summary: Moltbook, a Reddit-like site advertised as a "social network built exclusively for AI agents," inadvertently revealed the private messages shared between agents, the email addresses of more than 6,000 owners, and more ‌than a million ‌credentials, Wiz said in a blog post.

articles.title: Elon Musk’s xAI launches Grok Imagine 1.0 amid sexualised images controversy
articles.summary: The upgrade expands Grok’s video capabilities and is now in wide release. However, it comes amid worries over AI’s safety practices and the controversy around the platform’s content moderation.

articles.title: NFL-Super Bowl in Silicon Valley to showcase tech innovation
articles.summary: The Bay Area is leveraging technology for this year's Super Bowl. Organisers are hosting an innovation summit, highlighting Silicon Valley's tech prowess. This region makes history by hosting both the Super Bowl and soccer World Cup games in the same year. This brings renewed energy and pride to the local community after the pandemic.

articles.title: Some companies tie AI to layoffs, but the reality is more complicated
articles.summary: Major companies like Amazon, Pinterest, and Expedia are announcing significant job cuts. While many firms cite artificial intelligence as the driving force behind these layoffs, experts suggest other factors like cost reduction and efficiency gains are also at play. This shift raises questions about the real impact of AI on the workforce and corporate strategies.

articles.title: Chinese tech giants trade cash for AI buzz
articles.summary: Chinese tech giants are luring users with cash offers before their reported upcoming releases of competing AI models this month. US media outlet the Information reported that the tech companies are also looking to release new AI models during the Lunar New Year holiday, following last year's DeepSeek surprise.

articles.title: From injury to diet to age verification: How AI is reshaping Indian athletes' training
articles.summary: From dietary recommendations to injury predictions and from age verification to psychological mapping -- artificial intelligence is set to become a force of change in Indian sports with a centralised data management system that would not just customise training but also track athletes' progress like never before.

articles.title: TikTok uninstalls jump 2.5 times in US; why thousands are deleting the app
articles.summary: The updated privacy policy states that it will collect sensitive personal information such as a user's racial or ethnic origin.

articles.title: One-horned rhinos roamed as far South as Tamil Nadu around 3500 years ago: Study
articles.summary: Four bone fragments, identified as belonging to an Indian rhino, were unearthed at Molapalayam, a neolithic site.

articles.title: Impact of AI on jobs is still unfolding, says CEA; assures of markets turnaround
articles.summary: Post-Budget 2026 | Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran said the labour market impact of AI is still at an early stage in India and globally; potential disruptions being addressed by focusing on skilling initiatives and jobs in sectors less likely to be affected by AI, such as allied healthcare economy, tourism, and the orange economy; cautioning that incentives alone cannot drive private capex and that the current state of global funk may continue for a few more years.

articles.title: CEA Nageswaran: India growth story intact despite valuation worries, global uncertainty
articles.summary: Chief Economic Adviser told CNBC-TV18 that FII outflows, US policy uncertainty and sector issues weigh on markets, but India’s growth story and fundamentals remain strong despite volatility.

articles.title: Disinvestment mojo intact, ₹80,000 cr not scary, says DIPAM secy; more OFSs, QIPs ahead
articles.summary: The government has not lost its disinvestment momentum, is confident of meeting the ₹80,000-crore target, and expects more PSU OFSs and QIPs in FY26 and FY27, DIPAM Secretary Arunish Chawla said in conversation with CNBC-TV18 at a post-Budget event.

articles.title: Explained: How India’s coconut economy is paying rich dividends
articles.summary: Budget 2026 proposed a comprehensive Coconut Production Scheme to boost output and productivity. Here's a look at India’s position as the world’s largest coconut producer, its major growing regions and export markets, amid the government’s recent budget announcement for the sector.

articles.title: Ridham Desai sees biggest macro-market gap in decades in India, valuations at rare discount
articles.summary: Ridham Desai, Managing Director and Chief Equity Strategist (India) at Morgan Stanley, believes the market has underestimated India's strong macroeconomic fundamentals, creating a major disconnect. He lauded the Union Budget for its strategic push into Artificial Intelligence (AI), positioning India as the 'next big AI trade' through incentives for data centers and leveraging the nation's skilled workforce.

articles.title: India's Manufactuing PMI expands to 55.4 in January
articles.summary: In Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) parlance, a print above 50 means expansion while a score below 50 denotes contraction.

articles.title: Global equity correction risk rising, India may outperform: S Naren

He believes the negative reaction to the STT hike is unwarranted and identifies precious metals as the riskiest, most euphoric asset class currently.

articles.title: Budget 2026 doubles down on capex push as FM calls it highest in a decade; India Inc cheers

State-backed SDIC Commodities Co. was the highest-profile participant, they added, asking not to be named given the sensitivity of the matter.

This edition also breaks down Budget 2026’s fiscal math, looming lock-in expiries, the sharp sell-off in precious metals, stricter tax audit penalties, defence stocks in focus, and key takeaways from the Grammys 2026.

The port’s leadership said the milestone reflects workforce efficiency and ongoing modernisation efforts to support India’s expanding trade needs.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar funeral in Baramati: Sons perform last rites; Amit Shah, Fadnavis attend
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, 66, died on the morning of Wednesday, January 28, when a chartered Learjet carrying him crashed near the Baramati airstrip. Politicians across parties and states have reached Baramati to attend Ajit Pawar's last rites.

articles.title: How Ajit Pawar shaped Maharashtra politics: Key milestones and roles
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister, died in a plane crash near Baramati, ending a decades-long career marked by political influence, finance expertise, and NCP leadership. Baramati was both the beginning and the end of his political journey.

articles.title: Remembering Ajit Pawar: Baramati strongman and architect of coalition power
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, died at 66 in a plane crash at Baramati. His career spanned major political shifts, controversies, and a split from Sharad Pawar.

articles.title: Who is Manoj Mukund Naravane, former Chief of Army Staff, Rahul Gandhi referred to in Lok Sabha
articles.summary: Rahul Gandhi cited General Manoj Mukund Naravane's unpublished memoir Four Stars of Destiny, alleging the government blocked its release to hide details of the 2020 China border standoff.

articles.title: India January power use up 3.8% as cold pushes peak demand to 245 GW

articles.title: Maruti Suzuki January production at 2.26 lakh units; exports hit record high

articles.title: SC refuses to entertain PIL questioning procedures to record caste of citizens in 2027 census

articles.title: Memory chip price surge biggest near-term risk for smartphones, says Dixon CFO
articles.summary: Saurabh Gupta, Director–Finance and Group CFO of Dixon Technologies, said sharply rising memory chip prices, which have nearly doubled, are seriously hurting the low-end smartphone market. He added that this cost pressure has already contributed to a 7% market decline in the previous quarter and will remain a key factor to watch for the industry.

articles.title: Alibaba to spend $431 million for Lunar New Year AI push as chatbot war heats up
articles.summary: Tencent and Baidu announced late last month they would spend 1 billion yuan and 500 million yuan respectively on similar promotions for their AI chatbots.

articles.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX launches Stargaze for safer satellite operations
articles.summary: By providing free ephemeris sharing and conjunction screening, SpaceX aims to encourage satellite operators to adopt more transparent and safer orbital practices.

articles.title: Apple acquires Israeli audio AI startup Q.ai
articles.summary: Apple did not say how it will use Q.ai's technology but said the startup has worked on new applications of machine learning to help devices understand whispered speech and to enhance audio in challenging environments.

articles.summary: SpaceX is exploring a merger with Tesla or xAI, aiming to unite rockets, Starlink, X, and Grok AI before a major IPO, Bloomberg and Reuters report. Tesla shares rose 3 percent after the news.

articles.summary: Taboola study with Columbia, Harvard, TUM, and Carnegie Mellon finds AI-generated ads match human ads in engagement, with higher click-through rates.

articles.title: Late to AI, but better placed: Economic Survey says India can skip the costly AI arms race
articles.summary: Its comparative advantage in the AI era, the Survey says, does not lie in building frontier-scale models. Instead, it lies in application-led innovation, the productive use of domestic data, the depth of human capital, and the ability of public institutions to coordinate distributed efforts across sectors.

articles.title: Tesla to invest $20 billion in AI, Robotaxis, and humanoid robots
articles.summary: The company plans to scale overall vehicle output, upgrade factories, expand AI infrastructure, and accelerate production of both Optimus robots and self-driving Robotaxi vehicles.

Zensar, whose key clients include Cisco, the City of San Diego, and Tesco Insurance, derives nearly 68% of its business from the US and 21% from the UK/EU.

Tejwani and Patil were signatories to the deal last year.

articles.title: How long you will live is mainly decided by your genes: Study
articles.summary: The findings are based on an analysis of more than a century of lifespan data from large Scandinavian twin cohorts in Denmark and Sweden. Researchers studied identical and non-identical twins raised together and apart, as well as siblings of US centenarians. Most participants were born between 1870 and 1935, a period marked by high mortality from infectious diseases and accidents.

articles.title: Rottweiler attack leaves Bengaluru woman with over 80 stitches
articles.summary: Days that once revolved around work, cuddles and caring for her breastfeeding child are now spent in a hospital bed, recovering from a brutal dog attack that has left her with more than 80 stitches across her face, throat and head — and scars that go far beyond the physical. Early on Jan 26, Shalini had stepped out for morning walk near home in HSR Layout’s Teachers’ Colony.

articles.title: Cheer for exports: Textiles, carpets, leather set to gain after India-US deal
articles.summary: With the trade deal announced, Indian goods are suddenly looking more competitive. This means that a product will face 18% additional tariff over the MFN or product-specific rate. At 18%, the levy on Indian garments will be marginally lower than the 20% faced by those made in Bangladesh or Sri Lanka.
